Dick Cheney, former US vice president and 'father' of the Iraq invasion, has died
subhead: During President George W. Bush's two terms, Cheney, a foreign policy hawk who was deeply influenced by conservative ideas, embodied the excesses of the war on terror. He died at the age of 84, his family announced on November 4.

Lyon police catch suspects red-handed after a €28 million gold heist
subhead: Five people in possession of 306 kilograms of gold were arrested on Thursday, shortly after an attack on a precious metals processing company. They were charged on Monday.

title: Cement maker Lafarge goes on trial in France for 'funding terrorism' in Syria
subhead: The company and eight former employees are standing trial for having paid money to jihadist groups to keep a plant in Syria running. Unusually, Lafarge had already pleaded guilty to this charge before US courts in 2022.

title: How New York became a nightmare for Airbnb
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (6/6). For the past two years, short-term tourist rentals have effectively been banned in the American metropolis as the result of a massively complex regulatory overhaul. The platform is now hoping, without much optimism, to see the rules eased after the municipal elections on Tuesday.

title: Laurent Mauvignier wins 2025 Prix Goncourt for 'La Maison vide'
subhead: The writer won France's most prestigious literary prize for his monumental novel, a reinvention of his family's history across four generations, set in a rural French house.

Sudan: The UAE's shady role and Western nations' 'culpable indifference'
subhead: Allied with General Hemedti's Rapid Support Forces, the UAE has provided crucial logistical support to the paramilitary fighters who conducted the deadly assault on el-Fasher.

title: China uses subsidies, coercion and propaganda to boost falling birth rates
subhead: After zealously enforcing the one-child policy, the city of Tianmen has made boosting the birth rate a top priority, as fertility continues to decline across China.

title: The Orient Express pulls up in Paris: An opulent journey into the 1920s
subhead: The legendary luxury train is making a stop at Paris's Musée des Arts Décoratifs until spring. As part of the major exhibition dedicated to the centenary of Art Deco, three life-size mock-ups of the new Orient Express, set to return to service soon, are on display.
